page.title: 03SPECIAL SCHOOL
page.content: Here, the staff assess each child's problems and embark upon a basic educational course appropriate to the needs of the individual within one to two years, the information gathered is used to assist the educational psychologist in making an assessment of the future needs of the child. The staffing ratio in the Unit is 2 teachers and 2 assistants. The ESN (Educationally Sub Normal) Department has 90 places for children aged 7-16 years. Here the staffing level is 11 teachers and 5 classroom assistants. There are four junior classes each in charge of a class teacher for basic subjects, with specialist provision for swimming, physical education and craft.
